page.shortlink: Importing the Northwind Access Database into MySQL
page.topic: Importing the Northwind Access Database into MySQL
page.description: A step-by-step tutorial for importing the Northwind Access Database into MySQL.
page.discussion: The Northwind database is a Microsoft Access database that ships with Alpha Anywhere. In order to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on the Northwind Access database, the database must be copied to a directory where you have read/write access or converted to another database format. The Northwind Access database can be found inside the *[MDBFiles]* directory in your Alpha Anywhere installation. Your Alpha Anywhere install is typically located at *[bold:C:\Program Files (x86)\a5v12]*. In this tutorial, you will learn how to convert the Northwind Access database to a MySQL database.

section.note: This tutorial demonstrates importing the Northwind database into MySQL Server using MySQL Workbench 6.3 CE.

step.description: Download the [northwindmysql.zip] file and extract its contents somewhere on your computer. The .zip contains the Northwind Access database in a self-contained SQL file named "northwindmysql.sql".
Open MySQL Workbench. Under *[ui:Management]*, open the *[ui:Data Import/Restore]* tool.
On the *[ui:Import from Disk]* tab, select *[ui:Import from Self-Contained File]*. Use the browse button to select the *[northwindmysql.sql]* file you extracted from the download in the first step.
Select the *[ui:Default Target Schema:]*. The *[northwindmysql.sql]* file does not have a target schema. Name the target schema "northwind".
Click the [start import] Start Import button to import the Northwind database into the selected target schema. The *[ui:Import Progress]* tab will display the progress of the import.
You should now see a list of tables in the *[northwind]* schema. The Northwind database is now imported into MySQL.

section.title: Build a MySQL Connection String
section.description: Now that the Northwind database has been imported into MySQL, the next step is to create a Connection String to the database.

step.description: From the Web Projects Control Panel, select *[ui:[ManageConnStr] Manage Connection Strings]* > *[ui:Alpha DAO Connection strings]* from the *[ui:Edit]* menu to create a new connection string.
Click the *[ui:New]* button to create a new connection string. Type in "Northwind" for the *[ui:Connection Name]* and click the *[ui:Build]* button to construct the *[ui:Connection String]*.

figure.title: Creating a new connection to the Northwind MySQL database.

step.description: Select *[MySQL]* from the list of options in the *[ui:Select an API]* window and click *[ui:OK]*.

figure.title: Set the Connection Type to MySQL.

step.description: Configure the MySQL *[ui:Options]* for the connection. Choose the *[ui:Version]* of MySQL that is installed.
Enter "localhost" in *[ui:Hostname]*. If the MySQL database is hosted on another computer, enter the host IP address. For example, *[ui:127.0.0.1]*.
Enter the MySQL *[ui:Port]* number. The default port number for a typical MySQL installation is "3306".
Enter the *[ui:User]* for accessing the MySQL database. On your development machine, this can be "root" or a user account you created.
Enter the password for the *[ui:User]* account specified.

Verify the connection to MySQL is correct by clicking the *[ui:Test Connection]* button. You should see a success message. If you receive an error message, verify the *[ui:Hostname]*, *[ui:Port]*, *[ui:User]*, and *[ui:Password]* are correct.

figure.title: Success! The connection string to the MySQL database works.

step.description: Select the MySQL Northwind database you created from the *[ui:Database]* list. If *[ui:Database]* does not have any options, click the *[ui:Refresh]* button. If it still does not list any databases, verify the User you have chosen has access to the MySQL Northwind database.

figure.title: Configuring the MySQL connection string. The Northwind database in this MySQL instance is named "northwind".

step.description: Click *[ui:OK]* to create the MySQL connection string.

figure.title: Click OK to save the MySQL Connection string.

step.description: Click *[ui:OK]* to save the new Northwind connection string.

figure.title: Click OK to save the Northwind connection string.

step.description: Click the *[ui:Close]* button to exit the *[ui:AlphaDAO Connections]* dialog. You can now build a mobile or web application that communicates with the Northwind MySQL database. [Click here] for a list of tutorials that use the Northwind database.

figure.title: The Northwind AlphaDAO connection string for MySQL
